content: in a legal case that lasted for over two years the harju county court made a final decision the details of the case and the parties involved are not mentioned the court ruled that one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs but the exact amount is not specified the court dismissed some claims and counterclaims and divided the joint assets of the parties the apartment will be owned solely by one party while the other party will receive financial compensation the court also assigned the joint loan obligation to one party who must pay the other party a monetary compensation various other claims were dismissed and compensations were ordered based on the division of joint property the court considered the obligations of both parties and offset the mutual claims the court also ordered necessary changes to the property ownership registry the costs of the proceedings will be borne by both parties either party can appeal the decision within 30 days the court based its decision on the evidence presented and applied relevant sections of the civil code and the family law act disputes regarding the value of assets such as a car were resolved based on expert opinions the court also addressed claims for loans gifts and the return of items the court ordered compensations and divisions accordingly the court found one party responsible for causing damage to the other party and rejected some claims due to lack of evidence as a result the court ordered the transfer of apartment ownership financial compensations and the division of the joint loan obligation the court dismissed certain claims and ordered compensations for others the final compensation to be paid by one party to the other was determined the court also ordered the plaintiff to give consent for the defendant to become the sole owner of the apartment each party will bear their own procedural costs and the specific financial amount will be determined by the court
